billEvents.eventText: REFERRED TO COMMERCE, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND SMALL BUSINESS

title: Enacts the New York State bicycle tourism promotion act
summary: Enacts the New York State bicycle tourism promotion act; authorizes the issuance of grants for the purchase of equipment and operation of a bicycle tourism kiosk; authorizes the establishment of up to fifteen such kiosks.
currentCommittee: COMMERCE, ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT AND SMALL BUSINESS

S T A T E   O F   N E W   Y O R K
       ________________________________________________________________________

                                         2702

                              2011-2012 Regular Sessions

                                   I N  S E N A T E

                                   January 28, 2011
                                      ___________

       Introduced  by  Sens.  SERRANO, ADAMS, KRUEGER -- read twice and ordered
         printed, and  when  printed  to  be  committed  to  the  Committee  on
         Commerce, Economic Development and Small Business

       AN  ACT  to  amend the economic development law, in relation to creating
         the New York State bicycle tourism promotion act

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  The  economic  development law is amended by adding a new
    2  article 18 to read as follows:
    3                                 ARTICLE 18
    4                NEW YORK STATE BICYCLE TOURISM PROMOTION ACT
    5  SECTION 360. SHORT TITLE.
    6          361. STATEMENT OF LEGISLATIVE INTENT.
    7          362. DEFINITIONS.
    8          363. ADMINISTRATION.
    9          364. GRANTS FOR LOCAL BICYCLE TOURISM KIOSK.
   10          365. PROGRAM REVIEW.
   11    S 360. SHORT TITLE. THIS ACT SHALL BE KNOWN AND MAY BE  CITED  AS  THE
   12  NEW YORK STATE BICYCLE TOURISM PROMOTION ACT.
   13    S 361. STATEMENT  OF LEGISLATIVE INTENT. THE LEGISLATURE HEREBY RECOG-
   14  NIZES THE ROLE THAT CYCLING PLAYS IN LOCAL TOURISM. INCREASINGLY,  BICY-
   15  CLES  ARE  UTILIZED  BY  TRAVELERS TO EXPLORE LOCAL COMMUNITIES, OR AS A
   16  METHOD OF TRAVEL THROUGH THE  STATE.  AS  BICYCLES  HELP  EXPAND  TRAVEL
   17  DESTINATIONS,  AND ADD TO EXPERIENCE BASED TOURISM, THE STATE SHOULD ACT
   18  TO SUPPORT THE GROWTH IN THIS SECTOR. IT IS THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS LEGIS-
   19  LATION TO ESTABLISH A  WORKING  FLEET  OF  RENTAL  BIKES  AT  CONVENTION
   20  BUREAUS, VISITOR CENTERS AND POINTS OF INTEREST THAT ARE HEAVILY VISITED
   21  BY  TOURISTS  AND PROFESSIONALS. ADDITIONALLY, THE LEGISLATURE WISHES TO
   22  PROVIDE A MECHANISM TO CONNECT VISITING PROFESSIONALS AND TRAVELERS WITH
   23  INFORMATION AND MAPS OF BICYCLING ROUTES AND DESTINATION POINTS.

        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
                                                                  LBD00151-01-1

       S. 2702                             2

    1    S 362. DEFINITIONS. AS USED IN THIS ACT, "BICYCLE TOURISM KIOSK" SHALL
    2  MEAN A CENTRAL LOCATION EASILY ACCESSIBLE BY  TOURISTS  WHERE  BICYCLES,
    3  BICYCLING  SAFETY  EQUIPMENT  AND A LOCAL BICYCLE ROUTE MAP ARE PROVIDED
    4  FOR RENTAL AND USE.
    5    S 363. ADMINISTRATION.  1.  THE DEPARTMENT SHALL ADOPT GUIDELINES FOR,
    6  AND ADMINISTER A PROGRAM TO PROMOTE BICYCLE TOURISM  IN  LOCAL  COMMUNI-
    7  TIES. IN DOING SO, THE DEPARTMENT SHALL:
    8    (A)  SOLICIT  AND  ACCEPT PROPOSALS FROM LOCAL TOURISM PROMOTION AGEN-
    9  CIES, CONVENTION AND VISITORS BUREAUS AND CHAMBERS OF COMMERCE TO  IDEN-
   10  TIFY POTENTIAL BICYCLE ROUTES AND HOST A BICYCLE TOURISM KIOSK;
   11    (B)  EVALUATE  THOSE  PROPOSALS TO ENSURE THAT PROPOSED BICYCLE ROUTES
   12  WILL PROVIDE TRAVELERS WITH AN ADEQUATE EXPERIENCE BASED ON THE PROXIMI-
   13  TY OF POINTS OF INTEREST AND TOURISM  ATTRACTIONS  TO  PROPOSED  BICYCLE
   14  ROUTES; AND
   15    (C)  PROVIDE THAT NO BICYCLES SHALL BE RENTED WITHOUT ALSO PROVIDING A
   16  BICYCLE HELMET, OR HAVING BEEN PROVIDED  THAT  THE  PERSON  RENTING  THE
   17  BICYCLE HAS IN HIS OR HER POSSESSION A HELMET TO BE USED WHILE OPERATING
   18  SUCH BICYCLE.
   19    2.  THE  DEPARTMENT  MAY  APPROVE  UP TO FIFTEEN PROPOSALS TO CREATE A
   20  LOCAL BICYCLE TOURISM KIOSK.
   21    3. NOTHING SHALL PROHIBIT  THE  DEPARTMENT  FROM  CONTRACTING  WITH  A
   22  STATEWIDE  BICYCLING ORGANIZATION FOR THE PURPOSES OF IDENTIFYING POTEN-
   23  TIAL AREAS FOR A BICYCLE TOURISM PROGRAM, EVALUATING PROPOSALS SUBMITTED
   24  TO THE DEPARTMENT AND LOCALLY ADMINISTERING GRANTS PROVIDED  UNDER  THIS
   25  ARTICLE.
   26    S  364.  GRANTS  FOR  LOCAL  BICYCLE  TOURISM  KIOSK. 1. FROM EXISTING
   27  AMOUNTS APPROPRIATED FOR TOURISM PROMOTION, AND ANY OTHER AMOUNTS APPRO-
   28  PRIATED FOR THE PROGRAM, THE DEPARTMENT SHALL PROVIDE GRANTS TO  TOURISM
   29  PROMOTION  AGENCIES,  CONVENTIONS  AND  VISITORS  BUREAUS,  CHAMBERS  OF
   30  COMMERCE, OR A LOCAL GOVERNMENT FOR THE PURCHASE OF EQUIPMENT AND OPERA-
   31  TION OF A BICYCLE TOURISM KIOSK.
   32    2. THE DEPARTMENT MAY CONTRACT WITH A STATEWIDE BICYCLING ORGANIZATION
   33  TO ADMINISTER GRANTS PROVIDED UNDER THIS ARTICLE.
   34    3. NO SINGLE GRANT MAY EXCEED TWENTY THOUSAND DOLLARS.
   35    4. ELIGIBLE USES  FOR  GRANTS  PROVIDED  UNDER  THIS  SECTION  ARE  AS
   36  FOLLOWS:
   37    (A)  FOR  THE  PURCHASE  OF  BICYCLES,  HELMETS, LOCKS, BICYCLE TOOLS,
   38  STATIONARY BICYCLE RACKS, AND ANY OTHER EQUIPMENT NECESSARY TO  MAINTAIN
   39  AND PROVIDE SAFE BICYCLE RENTALS;
   40    (B)  FOR  PERSONAL  SERVICE COSTS, PROVIDED HOWEVER THAT SUCH PERSONAL
   41  SERVICE COSTS SHALL NOT EXCEED NINE THOUSAND DOLLARS PER GRANT;
   42    (C) FOR ANY OTHER COSTS NECESSARY TO LEASE OR PURCHASE SPACE TO  OPER-
   43  ATE A BICYCLE TOURISM KIOSK; AND
   44    (D)  FOR  REASONABLE  NON-PERSONAL  SERVICE  COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE
   45  OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF A BICYCLE TOURISM KIOSK.
   46    S 365. PROGRAM REVIEW. THE DEPARTMENT  SHALL,  SIX  MONTHS  AFTER  THE
   47  AWARDING  OF GRANTS UNDER THIS ARTICLE, CAUSE TO BE PRODUCED A REVIEW OF
   48  THE PROGRAM. A REPORT ON THE EFFECTIVENESS  OF  THIS  PROGRAM  SHALL  BE
   49  SUBMITTED TO THE GOVERNOR, TEMPORARY PRESIDENT OF THE SENATE, AND SPEAK-
   50  ER OF THE ASSEMBLY.
   51    S 2. This act shall take effect immediately.
actClause: AN ACT to amend the economic development law, in relation to creating the New York State bicycle tourism promotion act
